results.title: Plant pests and diseases: raspberry beetle
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ackroyd, Shell Film Unit and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: Shows details of the life cycle of the raspberry beetle, the cause of much damage in soft-fruit crops. Shows the adult beetle feeding on unopened flower buds; mating and laying of eggs on the flower; the destruction of young berries by larvae; burrowing of larvae into plug of the fruit and consequent exposure to secondary damage by mould.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Ackroyd, Shell Film Unit and J.V. Durden

results.title: Plant movements
results.creator_credit: Peter Boulton, Boulton-Hawker Films and Education Foundation for Visual Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Botany”.
Time-lapse photography is used as an aid to the understanding of plant movements. These movements are contrasted with those of animals, and the ways in which they enable the plant to obtain its requirements are explained.

results.title: Plant growth
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The sweetpea is used as an example of the growth of plants and the film presents the complete life history from sprouting seed to the dispersal of the ripened seeds in the mature plant.

results.title: Plant-animal Communities: the changing balance of nature
results.brief_description: Uses various plant and animal examples to illustrate how such constantly changing factors as the rate of reproduction of a species, its available food supply, and the number of its natural enemies largely determine the survival of a species within a biome. Also shows some of the factors, including humans, which may upset the balance of a community.

results.title: Planning your career (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
In many organisations, preparation for people to assume management positions is often poor and unstructured. While people should undertake career planning, organisations should also encourage career development skills. This episode focuses on two case studies of cadet mangement programs operating at the ANZ Bank and Coles Myer.

results.title: Planning for personal and professional growth
results.creator_credit: George L. George, Sturgis-Grant Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
Shows how teachers need to maintain their own mental growth and resilience to make the most of teaching. Dramatises cases of four typical teachers to explain how a teacher can avoid failure and frustration, and give inspiration instead of boredom to their charges. Stresses that teachers need to make conscious effort to deepen their understanding.
